intro: Lacellia, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its silvery or grayish foliage, which is covered in fine, dense hairs. The leaves are typically narrow and elongated, often arranged alternately along the stems. Lacellia species are native to regions of southern Africa, where they thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. These plants produce small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, attracting various pollinators.
